mainmatter.p:
A locale X is called spectral if it satisfies the following two conditions.
Every open of X is expressible as a join of compact opens of X.
The set of compact elements of X forms a sub-meet-semilattice of the frame \mathcal{O} ( X ).

frontmatter.meta: Personal communication with Martín H. Escardó

mainmatter.p:
Given a set X, the following are equivalent:
\mathcal{P} ( X ) is a spectral frame.
X is Kuratowski-finite and has decidable equality.
X is Bishop-finite.
\mathcal{P} ( X ) is a Stone frame.
